apps.lti13.config module¶

class apps.lti13.config.DjangoDbToolConf[source]¶

Bases: ToolConfAbstract

check_iss_has_many_clients(iss)[source]¶

Should return True for all new ToolConf-s

check_iss_has_one_client(iss)[source]¶

Two methods check_iss_has_one_client / check_iss_has_many_clients are needed for the the backward compatibility with the previous versions of the library (1.4.0 and early) where ToolConfDict supported only client_id per iss. Should return False for all new ToolConf-s

find_deployment(iss, deployment_id)[source]¶

Find deployment in case if iss has only one client id, i.e in case of { … “iss”: { … “client_id: “client” … }, … } config.

You may skip implementation of this method in case if all iss in your config could have more than one client id.

find_deployment_by_params(iss, deployment_id, client_id, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Find deployment in case if iss has many client ids, i.e in case of { … “iss”: [ { … “client_id: “client1” … }, { … “client_id: “client2” … } ], … } config.

You may skip implementation of this method in case if all iss in your config couldn’t have more than one client id, but it is outdated and not recommended way of storing configuration.

find_registration_by_issuer(iss, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Find registration in case if iss has only one client id, i.e in case of { … “iss”: { … “client_id: “client” … }, … } config.

You may skip implementation of this method in case if all iss in your config could have more than one client id.

find_registration_by_params(iss, client_id, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Find registration in case if iss has many client ids, i.e in case of { … “iss”: [ { … “client_id: “client1” … }, { … “client_id: “client2” … } ], … } config.

You may skip implementation of this method in case if all iss in your config couldn’t have more than one client id, but it is outdated and not recommended way of storing configuration.
